intro: Trioptolemea montana, commonly known as the mountain trioptolemea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Trioptolemea montana is often found in rocky or forested habitats at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 3,000 meters.
